New Records: Adolis García broke the record for most RBI in a postseason series with 15.
García's home run streak is tied for fourth-longest in postseason history.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager hit a long homer in a three-run first inning.
Adolis García homered twice and drove in five runs.
Jordan Montgomery pitched 2 1/3 scoreless innings for the win.
Pre-Game Insights: The Rangers, one of six major league teams without a World Series title, were playing in their first berth in the Fall Classic since 2011.
Post-Match Reflections: Bruce Bochy, who came out of retirement this season to manage the Rangers, became the first skipper to win a League Championship Series with three different teams.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have gone 8-0 away from home in these playoffs, joining the 1996 Yankees as the only teams to win their first eight road games in one postseason.
Others: Jose Altuve hit his 27th career postseason homer in the ninth for Houston, two behind Manny Ramirez for most all-time.
